body.p:
Bath Co Ky Jan ^the^ 13 1864
Hon Mr Bramlett

Dear Sir I seat Myself to write you A few lines to let you no My trobel situation praying you you to pardon A fine Against My Husban Ephraim Goodwin he had a pertition drew & Sine in december last & sent to you hopeing & praying you would pardon said fine this fine was found in Bath Court Some Severals years Ago the Judge the it was tried Before & Sherriff & the Most of the Jurors is all in the Rebel army My Husban has no Recollection of ever Bein Notified for trial on Said fine nor New Nothing About it till of late I will tell you situation of My family last September A year Ago the Rebels had posesion here & My Husban had to lay out to save his life 3 weekes Which cause him to lose his health the Rebels come last Spring & took the last Work horse we had & Robed our house of Sutch as they wanted we are poor people & if we have to pay this unlawfull fine Me & family is Bound to come to want for we cant keep house I Beg for God Sake for My Sake & for the Sake of My family please pardon a do parden this fine
pleas write A few lines in haste if the pertition eveer Reached you or not for the Sherriff Says he wont waite Many days longer for us to get A answer from you I no you are a Hy Honerable gentleman o this war has Ruin us poor Union people of this part of the State you the Guerrillers come form the Mountains in one Night time & Robs & plunders & Makes there Escape Back please pardon the Said fine & I will Be your unble Servant you eveer write Owingsvill Bath Co Ky or Sherboun Mill Flemin Co Ky Either place will do you God Sake write & let me no My doom you can save Me & you only from Suffering

Your umble Servants
Ephraim Goodwin
Mary A Goodwin

Bath Cir Ct. vs
E. Goodwin
